reviews.review_msg: Dr. Barenscott was one of the best profs I've ever had. Her lectures are super engaging and loves when students give her artwork that they've made. Such an amazing woman. She may seem tough and strict at first but as long as you do your journals and take good notes, you'll do well.
She actually knows how to teach art in a way that makes you want to know more. We took her for granted first term and now we have Denise and all collectively shout #bringDorthyback

She doesn't care about her students, doesn't like emails, her offices hours are ONLY on Thursdays 5:20 to 6:20pm, and speaks extremely fast. Her exams were really hard and she marks as if she doesn't want you to succeed. I still love Modern Art History, but she made me not like it during these classes because of her teaching.
Speaks too fast, a bad attitude. Assumes all students will finish a 22 page reading in 30 minutes and give a short amount of time for reflective journals.

The information-heavy lectures were difficult to get through, but she was well aware of it and stayed engaging and compassionate. In-class participation was a bit intimidating but she is respectful; enjoyable to talk to during breaks/office hours. School required a textbook for the class but it wasn't necessary. Try not to miss a class or project.

Dr. Barenscott is passionate about her lectures. She will make the class so enjoyable that you will dissolve into the materials even if you don't have any interest in learning about art history. The whole course is about discussing paintings, how interesting it is! The best part is that we get to work on our journals, providing our creativity.

Dr. Barenscott is the best prof I have ever had. She is incredibly passionate and engaging and clearly loves her students. Her lectures are fast-paced and content-heavy, but she makes sure to answer questions and give time for breaks. She is always making it known that she has plenty of availability during her office hours. She's a queen.

Dr.b is a real Gem. She knows what she is doing and takes her course seriously. You have to work for your grade, she is a fair grader so if you work hard don't worry about the result. Skip a class? you won't pass. Although she works based on textbooks, I didn't use one. Therefore, pay extra extra attention to lectures and you will pass.

Dorothy made me love art history! She is knowledgeable, dynamic, and confident during her lectures, and responds well to questions! She may look intimidating but is very kind. She is very clear with her grading scale. BEWARE- group project! Its time consuming and annoying. Also most of us never read the text book, her lectures were well detailed
Probably one of my fav courses and Profs Ive had. She knows her stuff
Dorothy helped me discover a passion for art history which I would have never expected. As long as you pay attention and take good notes you should do fine in her class.

One of the most hardworking profs I have had. Lectures are long, heavy, and fast-paced. You must be able to write fast in order to have decent notes. The group project is (in my opinion) the worst part and time consuming. Other than that, I highly recommend voice recording if you cannot keep up with writing notes. Study hard for this class to pass.

Her lectures were always interesting and inspiring, I was never bored. She outlined what she expected very clearly, and her exams and marking scheme were fair. I would definitely take her course again if I could! She is one of the best teachers I have had at SFU.

someone please teach her to talk slowly. she wants you to take notes while she speaks like a bullet train. We are humans, i should be in the course outline *Do not take this course if you can't write and listen and think at the speed of a bullet* it would be helpful.
Her lectures are very interesting, and important. Her exams are based off what was said in lecture. She talks really fast, so bring a recorder. Don't skip!! Don't be late!!

Very engaging, and made content relatable, put many things in modern perspective. Lectures were 3 hours, but she always gave us a break. Tests were very straightforward, and she let us know exactly what to study which was very helpful. Felt like she was a bit unapproachable, but really was a nice person.

She has been one of the best professors  I have ever had, and one of the best at SFU.  The university should hire more teachers like her. She is inspirational, funny,  relevant, and will never let you down during lectures. She can turn a boring subject into an enjoyable one. I would recommend her any time, any day :)!

I found her to be intriguing and I was constantly engaged even into the late hours of the night (after I had been at school for 12 hours). really informative and easy to listen to, she didn't have many notes on her slides but I found it easy to remember what she discussed from week to week

Dorothy is wonderful; I miss her already. Apart from the tags... Pros: Passionate, clear- like a live TEDtalk every class! Warnings : A group assignment of a local historical object. Tests are tough. Each assignment worth 14. Thick textbook-I never read it but did well. She does fail many ppl!! Pro-tip: bring a tape recorder! never skip!
She is a super awesome and passionate prof! She made me like art history and made me learn a lot about culture. She is also funny and entertaining and the course load was easier than I expected :)

I love Dorothy! She's genuinely interested in the subject matter and is always available for help. Her lectures are super interesting and involved and I have yet to be bored by her. Taking her class is a must!
Dorothy is the best!!! I would take any course she teaches!

Dorothy is a wonderful prof, has a real passion for art that translates into her teaching. She's firey and direct, and has great eye for analyzing works. One note- her bark is bigger than her bite, and I mean that in a good way. She seems all bold and "intimidating" at the start of term, but is really just smart, warm and quite sweet.

It was a privilege to have Dorothy as a professor. She does speak fast; it's not an issue unless you're trying to take notes word-for-word, but do expect to take 4-5 pages of notes per class. Passionate, approachable, and gives the most stimulating and engaging lectures. Fantastic class.

Dorothy is amazing. Best lecturer I have ever experienced. You can't find a higher level of clarity and interest anywhere. I took this class on a last-minute whim and it has been my favourite class so far.
Such a fantastic class. So great I'm now double majoring in it. Dorothy is very passionate and thought me a lot.

FPA 111 sure is an interesting course to take. Dorothy's lecture is clear and understandable. Sometimes I think she speaks a little bit too fast though. Also, it is kind of scary for her to mention about the academic dishonesty thing all the time...
AWESOME. SHE TRANSPORTS YOU TO THE MOST INTERESTING MOMENTS IN ART'S WORLD.

The first time I took Dorothy's class I only took it to fulfill my requirement. I hardly had any interest in the subject....But now, after taking her class I'm so glad that I did! She is incredibly sincere and extremely passionate about art and it really shows in her lecture. I'm thinking about minoring in Art and Culture because I loved it so much

Really good lecturer, really concise and interesting. Definitely take youre into the arts. Covers everything from conceptual art to punk rock.Assignments consisted of reporting/reviewing on local art/music/dance/film/theatre events. Exams involve a lot of writing.  Make sure to take detailed notes in lecture and definitely participate in tutorial!
Definately recommend taking this course! Dorothy was engaging and i found the class to be extremely interesting!

Dorothy is an excellent prof! She's passionate about what she teaches and really knows her stuff. Her lectures are very interesting and a great eye opener. The exams were fair and very easy if you attended lectures and took notes. The course requires a lot of essay writing. Overall, one of the best profs I've had, take her if you get the chance!
I am in a sciences program, but i took her class and i found it very interesting. As long as you know how to write an essay and take notes during her lectures the class is not that hard.
I've already talked to Dorothy about changing my major after taking this class. Opened my eyes to a whole new subject area I would not have normally found as potentially interesting.
WHAT EVER YOU, PLEASE PLEASE DONT TAKE THIS COURSE JUST FOR THE SAKE OF B-HUM CREDIT!!! A DISASTER FOR ALL NON-ARTS STUDENT!
Dr. Barenscott is passionate, witty, and crazy smart. She actually likes contemporary art, which is more than many art historians!

She speeks really fast, I can't catch up with her on my notes. The exam questions are actually short essays! You'll have about 4 essays total in the whole term. One thing I can't agree is that, why you arrange another "final" essay before the final exam after the real final essay had been hand in?? It'll occupy our study time on the final exam! But

i want to be the first to say that she sucks at teaching. she doesnt adjust to the class despite their opinions and recommendations to improve the learning environment in this course. the format of her exams were ridiculous: they are TOO TIME PACED! my goodness, just let us work at OUR speed, NOT YOURS! despise her. SFU, DONT HIRE HER AGAIN!
Exams are extremely tough for anyone who is a poor writer.  Her lectures were generally interesting with a few exceptions which is better than most profs.
Dorothy is one of the best professors i've ever had. She makes 3 hour lectures genuinely interesting.
